question: The historian Barani refused to consider the state in India under Delhi Sultans as truly Islamic due to which of the following reasons?
option1: the majority of the population did not follow Islam
option2: the Muslims theologists were often disregarded
option3: the Sultan supplemented the Muslim law by framing his own regulations
option4: religious freedom was accorded to non-Muslims
answer: the Muslims theologists were often disregarded
explanation: Zia-ud-din-Barani was a contemporary of Muhammad Tughlaq and Firoz Tughlaq. He enjoyed the patronage of both the sultans. He composed Tarikh-i-Firoz Shahi and Fatwa-i-Jahandari.
